page.title: 06INTERVIEW WITH MR WISKIN
page.content: Mr Wiskin told us he thought the fire was a terrible thing to happen but he is very pleased the building has been rebuilt.However many things couldn't be replaced like letters,photographs,plans and maps and teacher's work.He remembers the fire itself "Flames ,thick smoke,the stones of the building were too hot to touch,plastic chairs melted like toffee." The fire was started by people who broke in to steal crisps and chocolate but their lighted match was dropped onto the floor.A fireman was hurt when he fell through the floorboards.It took over a year to get the buildings back to normal.
